text: Argia sedula, the blue-ringed dancer, is a species of narrow-winged damselfly in the family Coenagrionidae. It is found in Central America and North America. The IUCN conservation status of Argia sedula is "LC", least concern, with no immediate threat to the species' survival. The population is stable. thumb thumb ==References== ==Further reading== * * * * Category:Coenagrionidae Category:Insects described in 1861
title: Argia sedula
